pull.title: Add compile time checking for cs_main locks which we assert at run time
pull.body: Assert locking requirements at compile-time (`EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(foo)`) instead of at run-time (`AssertLockHeld(â€¦)`).

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #13864 (validation: Document where we are intentionally ignoring bool return values from validation related functions by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: validation: Document where we are intentionally ignoring bool return values from validation related functions
issue.body:
* Document where we are intentionally ignoring the return value from `bool` returning functions from `validation.{cpp,h}` that modify state
* Mark validation functions whose `bool` return value should not be discarded in the general case with `NODISCARD` (expands to `[[nodiscard]]` or `__attribute__((warn_unused_result))` depending on availability)

This will help us identify code where we're we incorrectly assume that a certain function always succeeds in performing its state modification.

events.body: @practicalswift FYI https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13783#discussion_r218243419 maybe you should defer these changes?

@practicalswift In a similar vein to my comment [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14443#issuecomment-428417273), please remove the `AssertLockHeld` changes from this PR. Leaving just the `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED` changes.
Agree with the previous feedback, also please squash your commits.

events.message: Add compile time checking for cs_main locks which we assert at run time

events.body: @promag @fanquake @MarcoFalke Thanks for the quick review and the clear feedback. Feedback addressed. Please re-review.

rename.from: Assert locking requirements at compile-time instead of at run-time
rename.to: Add compile time checking for cs_main locks which we assert at run time

issue.title: Meta-issue: Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations
issue.body:
This meta-issue tracks the status of the Clang thread safety analysis PRs.

- [x] Fix `-Wthread-safety-analysis` warnings. Compile with `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available. (#10866)
- [x] travis: Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X (#10923)
- [x] net: Add missing lock in `ProcessHeadersMessage(...)` (#11578)
- [x] addrman: Add missing lock in `Clear()` (CAddrMan) (#11585)
- [x] rpc: Lock `cs_main` in `blockToJSON`/`blockheaderToJSON` (#11618)
- [x] Avoid lock: Call `FlushStateToDisk(...)` regardless of `fCheckForPruning` (#11617)
- [x] tests: Add missing locks to tests (#11623)
- [x] Add missing `cs_wallet`/`cs_KeyStore` locks to wallet (#11634)
- [ ] Add missing locks: `validation.cpp` + related (#11652)
- [x] mempool: Fix missing locking in `CTxMemPool::check(â€¦)` and `CTxMemPool::setSanityCheck(â€¦)` (#11689)
- [x] qt: Remove redundant locks (#11733)
- [x] net: Add missing locks in `net.{cpp,h}` (#11744)
- [x] Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread (#11762)
- [x] net: Avoid locking `cs_vNodes` twice when calling `FindNode(...)`. Add `NodeExists(...)` (#11795)
- [x] tests: Make `test_bitcoin` pass under ThreadSanitzer (`clang`). Fix lock-order-inversion (potential deadlock). (#12882)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_KeyStore` runtime locking assertions (#13077)
- [x] mempool: Add compile time checking for all `::mempool.cs` runtime locking assertions (#13080)
- [x] wallet: Add compile time checking for all `cs_wallet` runtime locking assertions (#13081)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_main` runtime locking assertions (#13083)
- [x] wallet/keystore: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_KeyStore` (#13114)
- [x] addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_addrMan` (#13115)
- [x] Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_{rpcWarmup,nTimeOffset,warnings}` (#13116)
- [x] net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code (#13123)
- [x] scheduler: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `m_cs_callbacks_pending` (#13125)
- [x] util: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_args` (#13126)
- [x] wallet: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_db` (#13127)
- [x] policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator` (#13128)
- [x] Move `cs_main` locking annotations from `.cpp` to `.h` (#14063)
- [x] tests: Add missing locking annotations and locks (`g_cs_orphans`) (#14108)
- [x] Add compile time checking for `cs_main` locks which we assert at run time (#14444)

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.18 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.18 (Aug 13, 2018, to Mar 3, 2019), oldest to newest (when merged to the master branch).

UPDATE 2021-May-4: This PR is complete, ready for review.

NOTE: This PR's branch is based on #5034, which hasn't merged yet, so its commits appear here also. For the current PR, please review only commit "Add missing locks and locking annotations for CAddrMan" and beyond (I will remove this comment before this PR gets merged.)

Each commit also includes a reference both to the PR and the upstream commit.

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13115
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14444
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11634
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13123
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14953
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12153
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15322
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15321
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15201
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15365

labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: I-race
labels.description: Problems and improvements related to race conditions.
